title: Principles of Practice
description: Advanced exploration of practice covering current research and industry practices.

title: Introduction to Practice
description: Rigorous treatment of practice theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Intermediate Methods
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of methods. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Intermediate Theory
description: Rigorous treatment of theory theory and applications with emphasis on research methodology.

title: Advanced Research
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of research. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.

title: Seminar
description: In-depth analysis of seminar principles. Students will develop critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

title: Analysis
description: Comprehensive study of analysis with emphasis on theoretical foundations and practical applications.

title: Graduate Applications
description: Interdisciplinary approach to applications combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: FINA 343 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Advanced Workshop
description: Interdisciplinary approach to workshop combining theoretical knowledge with practical problem-solving.
prerequisites: FINA 378 and senior standing or graduate status

title: Graduate Applications
description: Fundamental concepts and applications of applications. Designed for students pursuing careers in related fields.
prerequisites: FINA 361 and senior standing or graduate status
